title: Limit Outdoor Time
text: Shorten walks during extremely cold days. Multiple short play sessions are better than one long exposure.

title: Protect Their Paws
text: Use booties or apply paw balm to avoid cracked pads from ice and salt. Always rinse paws after walks.

title: Dress in Layers
text: Use warm, breathable layers: a base layer (light) + an insulated coat for very cold days. Avoid overheating indoors.

title: Adjust Food & Hydration
text: Pets may need slightly more calories if they stay outdoors more, but always consult your vet. Keep water unfrozen and available.

title: Watch For Hypothermia
text: Signs include shivering, slow breathing, and lethargy. Move the pet indoors and contact a vet if you suspect hypothermia.
